bug.short_desc: XMLHttpRequest: Use native support for timeout whenever available

long_desc.thetext:
(This is similar to a feature request [1] opened in the XMLHttpRequest project. The best part is that the script fallback is already built into qooxdoo!)
The XMLHttpRequest level 2 specification recently added timeout support [2], AFAIK by "inheriting" the the feature introduced in IE8 [3]. Nightly Gecko builds already support this feature [4], which will likely be shipped in Firefox 13, so it would be great to take advantage of native support whenever available: * Try to detect the `timeout` attribute and/or `ontimeout` event and use the native feature, when available; * Fallback to the script implementation already available on non-supporting environments.
[1] https://github.com/ilinsky/xmlhttprequest/issues/5 [2] http://www.w3.org/TR/XMLHttpRequest/#the-timeout-attribute [3] http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc304105%28VS.85%29.aspx [4] https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=525816

(In reply to comment #0) > Nightly Gecko builds already support this feature [4], > which will likely be shipped in Firefox 13
Apparently this will make it into Firefox 12: https://developer.mozilla.org/en/DOM/XMLHttpRequest/Using_XMLHttpRequest#Example:_using_a_timeout
(Current release version is 11, so beta users will already be able to use this feature and 12 will likely be released soon, given the recently short release cycle.)
Move open issues to RESOLVED – LATER, whose last comment is older than a year.
